experience: You and Laurent both know Neha Prajapat
Power, Performance and Thermal Validation Manager - Intel SSDs

Leading the team responsible for the performance of Intel latest Solid State Drives.  - responsibilities include working with customers and architects to develop workloads, benchmarks and validation capabilities- debug include analysis of system bottleneck, development of characterization tool and methodologies and quantification of performance/power trade offs.
Post-silicon Validation Manager - Intel Core CPUs

- Led a team of 20+ engineers driving the change of validation practices from synthetic to OS based validation- Delivered recommendations on how to modify validation content and overall methodology therefore reducing costs and freeing up substantial resources for upcoming programs - Led the Validation Tech Readiness phase for Intel's 10nm processor including budget and resource forecasting.

- Led a team of 18 engineers and technicians for the post silicon validation of binary translation CPUs- The team laid solid foundations and documented BKMs for future products- Transitioned the team to validate concurrency and power management for Intel SOC products including phone and tablets CPUs. - The team insured early bug finding  and content readiness by making heavy use of pre-silicon development environments (emulator/simulator).
System Validation Manager - Intel Core CPU validation

- Managed the Random Instruction Testing team. Delivered unique concurrency validation capabilities for Intel newly integrated graphics engine- Pioneered the use of Scrum and agile practices into the department- Changed the department hiring process by introducing behavioral interviewing practices
Technical Program Manager - Intel Core CPU validation

- Managed the post silicon validation program for Intel Core Client CPUs including laptop and desktop processors.- Coordinated the work of logic and electrical validation teams to deliver Intel's newest process (45nm) - Represented the validation teams "one voice" for marketing and design organizations. - Leveraged previous programs Best Known Methods to insure fast power on and successful launch for the $30 billion program.
Graduated With Honor (Beta Gamma Sigma Honor Society)
Graduated With Honor (Beta Gamma Sigma Honor Society)

recommendations: Anand K Enamandram
Server Platform Architect, Data Center Group at Intel Corporation. Member, IEEE
September 14, 2016, Anand K reported directly to Laurent

I had the pleasure of working directly under Laurent's leadership for about three years. Laurent is an exceptionally strong leader who understands the big picture very well. He could size up any given situation, assess where the problems are, and follow through by solving them both at the technical and organizational level – these were often problems with very large scope and thereby, business impact. In doing so, he was able to leverage the skillset, experience and passion of his team by finding the “right” people for the job at hand and motivating them to do their best. He was a very strong believer in “hiring the right people and getting out of their way”, to let them do their job - an approach which I found to be very unique and extremely effective, especially with senior technical contributors. Not only did this build trust in the team, but it also allowed the team to think big and implement their very best ideas. I believe that this approach was (one of) the fundamental reasons that his leadership brought significant positive impact to the team in the long run. Overall, it was very refreshing to work for such a visionary and motivating leader like Laurent.
Anand K Enamandram

September 14, 2016, Laurent managed Anand K directly

summary: Curiosity is a  driving force in everything I do: I love to learn new skills by facing new challenges and coming up with innovative solutions to seemingly unsolvable problems. Throughout my career, I came to realize that while individual endeavors can be very rewarding, significant achievements come only by working with and through others. Managing both small teams and large groups has offered me the opportunity to develop further in this area. It has been both very humbling and very fulfilling.I love making new professional connections. Contact me if you want to talk impossible technological feats, how to motivate teams or the future of manned space exploration!
name: Laurent Lazard
title: Power, Performance and Thermal Validation Manager - Intel SSDs
